body_html: As of now batch_size=1 is by design. I suppose it is possible to support batch_size>1 with dynamic_rnn(), but the code got unreadable quickly the first time i tried. dynamic_rnn() based code is in general less readable already compared to the time-step unfolded code (which enjoys use of native python loops etc). I plan to revisit batch_size>1 support sometime in the future.
body_text: As of now batch_size=1 is by design. I suppose it is possible to support batch_size>1 with dynamic_rnn(), but the code got unreadable quickly the first time i tried. dynamic_rnn() based code is in general less readable already compared to the time-step unfolded code (which enjoys use of native python loops etc). I plan to revisit batch_size>1 support sometime in the future.
body: As of now `batch_size=1` is by design. I suppose it is possible to support `batch_size>1` with `dynamic_rnn()`, but the code got unreadable quickly the first time i tried. `dynamic_rnn()` based code is in general less readable already compared to the time-step unfolded code (which enjoys use of native python loops etc). I plan to revisit `batch_size>1` support sometime in the future.
